column4: can someone help me figure out why i get an input/output error with my external HDD?
i can't even transfer files over to my HDD... ;[
does anyone else has problems putting files on external hdd
halpp
none at all, look at your mount options
my mount options seems fine...
they can't be or you'd be able to write data.....
i get input/output error
then unmount the partition and fsck it
fsck in terminal?
yes, make sure its healthy
fsck from util-linux-ng 2.17.2?
if you just run fsck with suitable options on the unmounted partition, it should make sure itsok
it's totally unmounted and i still get the same fsck response...
i really need this to work so i can fresh install ;[
if you data is unhealthy, yes
it should be fine i just had it up not two hours ago and was transferring files.
i tried to create a text document there and it wouldn't let me do that or add files... i think i can still take files from there and put it on my machine fine.
i suggest you fsck -a /dev/partitionname    to ensure its health, then check mount options
No such file or directory while trying to open /dev/sbd1
if you run:  sudo fdisk -l    you can list the available partitions
well wouldn't it not show up because you had me unmount it?
